stories.title: Color-Changing Magnifying Glass Gives Clear View of Invisible Infrared Light
Pay-to-unlock features, Tesla-style, gain traction in motorcycling

stories.text: I've taken some time off of work out of NYC and don't have an apartment there now, my expenses have been much lower. I'd like to work in NYC on-site, but don't really have enough cash to pay deposit before starting to earn a paycheck.  Do you have any tips on getting a package that includes relocation expenses (or an apartment)? Is it possible in general?  I am a technical manager who worked as a startup founder and am returning to full-time work for family reasons.
stories.title: Ask HN: Any tips on getting relocation expenses? (NYC)
Parag Agrawal: Why Indian-Born CEOs Dominate Silicon Valley

stories.text:
In some of the companies I worked for (or know of) disclosing your salary was not allowed by contract.

But in most — there was no serious barriers, but still it was never talked about among colleagues except between very close friends.

Why is that, i wonder?

Why it is sometimes in the contract — what does employer gain from it?

Why people tend to avoid these discussions even when it is not forbidden?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why salaries are not openly discussed?
Spiral Dynamics: The Ultimate Theory of Human Development
